greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of natural numbers: a(n) = A126760(A249735(n)) = A249824(A064216(n)).
comment: Permutation obtained from the odd bisection of A003961 (or from the odd bisection of A048673).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: As a composition of related permutations:
example: a(5) = 9 because of the following. 2*A064216(5) = 2*4 = 8 = 2^3. We replace the prime factor 2 of 8 with the next prime 3 to get 3^3, then replace 3 with 5 to get 5^3 = 125. The smallest prime factor of 125 is 5. 125 is the 9th term of A084967: 5, 25, 35, 55, 65, 85, 95, 115, 125, ..., thus a(5) = 9.
mathematica: t = PositionIndex[FactorInteger[#][[1, 1]] & /@ Range[10^6]]; f[n_] := Times @@ Power[If[# == 1, 1, NextPrime@ #] & /@ First@ #, Last@ #] &@ Transpose@ FactorInteger@ n; Flatten@ Map[Position[Lookup[t, FactorInteger[#][[1, 1]] ], #] &[f@ f[2 #]] &, Table[Times @@ Power[If[# == 1, 1, NextPrime[#, -1]] & /@ First@ #, Last@ #] &@ Transpose@ FactorInteger[2 n - 1], {n, 87}]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 25 2016, Version 10 *)
program: (define (A249746 n) (define (Ainv_of_A007310off0 n) (+ (* 2 (floor->exact (/ n 6))) (/ (- (modulo n 6) 1) 4))) (+ 1 (Ainv_of_A007310off0 (A003961 (+ n n -1)))))
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 23 2014
